title: The theory of CS ownership.
body:
So before I start putting opinions into this:

No matter what circumstance, you **NEVER** own CS, unless you summoned it,If a player believes taking cs that "belongs" to you if its in best benefit of the team,its not trolling, its them trying to win but at your cost.

Alot of people complain about the issue stated, they believe that CS "belongs" to them becuase they are (insert lane carry).

so since there is only one lane that suffers this problem the most, we will talk about jungle camps.

There are hundreds of (shitty) chinese strats that has a top/mid/bot/whatever people do take a camp at the start for extra EXP and gold, and with pre-planned communication, no one gets upset, the player has fun and you win the game.

if a jungler go into your lane for "tax" that dosen't mean you deserve to go and take their camps, its like toxicity, someone calls you a "dumbass garbo yas", you don't get to call them "*** ****** ****** *******".

the theory of CS ownership dosen't exist.

no one owns CS.

thats all my rant.

agree, disagree.

Thats a problem for me on a another day.

replies.body: False. The enemy team owns those creeps.

THe only problem with that is that when you take the lane CS as a jungler you can put the laner behind in experience, gold, and you can put them in a bad position in lane if you don't push or hold it properly.  Generally its not a  good team thing to do.  Unless  you determine that the person has already lost lane and you need the CS to carry, that is something different.
